FuncDef:
The bandwidth command sets configuration bandwidth for an interface.
The undo bandwidth command cancels the configuration bandwidth set for an interface. The bandwidth command sets configuration bandwidth for an interface. The undo bandwidth command cancels the configuration bandwidth set for an interface. By default, no configuration bandwidth is set for an interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies configuration bandwidth for an interface. The bandwidth configured using this command is the expected bandwidth of an interface and does not directly affect traffic forwarding on the device. The bandwidth is generally used for traffic statistics collection on the NMS or route calculation using routing protocols.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1000000, and the default unit is Mbit/s.

ExtraInfo: The interface bandwidth can be classified into physical bandwidth and configuration bandwidth. This command is used to set the configuration bandwidth of an interface without changing the physical bandwidth of the interface. The NMS can view the configuration through the ifSpeed and ifHighSpeed objects in IF-MIB.
